p: Our modeling confirms that suppression is possible with plausible levels of social distancing and self-isolation, consistent with experience in multiple countries. Our research does not, however, support attempting to mitigate COVID-19 with the aim of building herd immunity. Achieving herd immunity while simultaneously maintaining hospital burden at manageable levels requires adaptive fine-tuning of mitigation efforts, in the face of imperfect epidemiological intelligenceâ€”something that is impractical.
